intro: Dalechampia stipulacea var. major, commonly known as the broad-leafed dalechampia, is a species native to the southeastern United States. It is a flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae, characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands and along stream banks, thriving in moist, sandy soils. Its foliage is often covered in fine, soft hairs, and it produces capsule fruits that release tiny seeds when mature.
